sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &tool; allows you to specify the way your system connect to other computers and to internet.

sect1.title: Getting started
sect1.para: You can start &tool; in the following ways:
When you start &tool;, you will be prompted for the administrator password, this is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the following window is displayed.
The &tool; main window contains four tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Shows all the configured network interfaces, it also allows you to modify their settings and to add or delete interfaces
Shows your system host name and domain, it also shows the way your system identifies itself in Windows networks.

Contains two sections, the DNS servers are what your computer use for resolving the IP addresses from the domain names. The search domains are the domains in which your system will search any host when any domain is specified.
Shows the list of aliases for accessing other computers.

sect2.title: To create a new interface
sect2.para: In the Connections section, press the Add button, depending on the interface type, you will need to provide different data:

listitem.para: You can specify if you want to configure automatically the interface through DHCP or BOOTP, or if you want to configure it manually providing its IP address, netmask and gateway.

You can specify if you want to configure automatically the interface through DHCP or BOOTP, or if you want to configure it manually providing its IP address, netmask and gateway. You also need to specify the network name (ESSID).

You have to specify the IP address that the interface will have, and the IP address of the system to which it will be connected. You can also specify that you want the remote host to be the default gateway.
You have to specify the phone number, username and password (this data is provided by the ISP), the modem device will be autodetected.

sect2.title: To modify an already existing interface
sect2.para: In the Connections section, select the interface you want to modify and press the Properties button, depending on the interface type you will be able to modify different data.

listitem.para: You can modify the way the interface is configured (DHCP, BOOTP or manually), if the interface is configured manually, you can also modify the interface IP address, netmask and gateway.

You can modify the way the interface is configured (DHCP, BOOTP or manually), if the interface is configured manually, you can also modify the interface IP address, netmask and gateway, you can also modify the network name (ESSID) for this interface.
You can modify the interface IP address, as well as the remote IP address.

You can modify the modem device, whether you want it to dial using tones or pulses, the modem volume, the phone number, the username and password that your ISP provided and other advanced settings for PPP.

sect2.title: To delete an interface
sect2.para: In the Connections section, select the interface you want to delete and press the Delete button.

sect2.title: To activate or deactivate an interface
sect2.para: In the Connections section, select the interface and press the Activate or Deactivate button.

sect2.title: To change your host name and domain name
sect2.para: In the General section, change the hostname or domain name text boxes.

sect2.title: To change the way your system identifies itself in Windows networks
sect2.para: In the General section, change the description or workgroup of your system in Windows networks. You can also specify the WINS server if you need one.

sect2.title: To add a new domain name server
sect2.para: In the DNS section, type the new DNS IP address in the DNS text box and press the Add button.

sect2.title: To delete a domain name server
sect2.para: In the DNS section, select a DNS IP address from the list and press the Delete button.

sect2.title: To add a new search domain
sect2.para: In the DNS section, type the new domain in the search domain text box and press the Add button.

sect2.title: To delete a search domain
sect2.para: In the DNS section, select a search domain from the list and press the Delete button.

sect2.title: To add a new host alias
sect2.para: In the Hosts section, type a new IP address and the aliases that will point to it and press the Add button.

sect2.title: To modify a host alias
sect2.para: In the Hosts section, select an alias from the list and modify the aliases in the text box.

sect2.title: To delete a host alias
sect2.para: In the Hosts section, select an alias from the list and press the Delete button.

sect2.title: To create a new profile
sect2.para: Press the Network profiles button, a new window will appear letting you to save your current configuration as a profile pressing the Save current button. You must specify a name for the profile, optionally you can specify a description for this profile.

sect2.title: To delete an already existing profile
sect2.para: Press the Network profiles button, in the network profiles window, select the profile you want to delete and press the Delete button.

sect2.title: To switch the current profile
sect2.para: Change the current network profile menu, all the configuration will be switched automatically to the chosen profile.
